definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: As such, political and social activism was an end in itself.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，政治和社会激进主义都将自动消亡。
激进主义者是个糟糕的外交家。

sentences.english: Sufism is opposed to radicalism and helps to promote Islam.
sentences.chinese: 苏菲反对激进主义并且帮助提升伊斯兰。

sentences.english: He continued his activism after returning in nineteen eighty-eight.
sentences.chinese: 一九八八年被释放后他仍然继续他的激进主义行为。

sentences.english: Isolation is far more likely to spawn more resentment and radicalism.
sentences.chinese: 孤立更可能会衍生更多的怨恨和激进主义。

sentences.english: He was a major influence in converting Godwin to political radicalism.
sentences.chinese: 戈德温变成政治激进主义者主要是受他的影响。

definition: reformism (i.e. favoring gradual change as opposed to revolution)

pinyin: You2 tai4 fu4 guo2 zhu3 yi4

definition: nationalism/national self-determination/principle of nationalism, the first of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning parity between China and the great powers)/racism

pinyin: she4 hui4 min2 zhu3 zhu3 yi4
duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4
